subject: p15809646
History: -year-old male patient with history of pulmonary fibrosis, COPD, sepsis. Study requested for evaluation of pulmonary edema and/or pneumothorax.
Findings: As compared to prior chest radiograph from, there has been interval placement of a Swan-Ganz catheter with the tip slightly beyond the mediastinum. Mild cardiomegaly is unchanged. Irregular bilateral lung opacities are stable. Chronic pleural thickening is unchanged. There are no pleural effusions or pneumothorax.
Impression: Interval placement of Swan-Ganz catheter with tip slightly beyond the mediastinum, for which consideration of withdrawing a few centimeters is recommended. These findings were discussed with Dr. By Dr. Telephone on at 4:30 PM, at time of discovery.
